Luna at least got her girl cum off, so this isn’t too bad.” Once dry, Lincoln donned one of his many spare sets of clothes and ran out just in time to be overtaken by the stampede of sisters. The boy with white hair was carried down the stairs as if by a mosh pit with zero sense of personal space. When the world stopped spinning, he found himself conveniently at the kid’s table with a plate full of pancakes. “… Well that worked out nicely.”

Lincoln ate his fill as everyone else did. Cries of orgasmic bliss came from the grown up table, but Lincoln couldn’t be bothered to see who it was. He’d had enough vore and sexiness in the last hour to last him a while. Right now, he just wanted to eat and get his day started properly… preferably with minimal food stains from his rowdy little sisters.

“So where’re ya headin’, Lincoln,” Lana asked. She’d just packed together a wad of pancakes half the size of her head and scarfed it down, creating a noticeable bulge down her throat and into her belly.

“Clyde and I are going to the comic store. There’s a sale today and we were looking to start a new series.”

“Mind if I join?” Lucy asked. “Vampires of Meloncholia is getting a comic spinoff and I’m curious if it’s any good.”

Lincoln grinned from ear-to-ear. “Finally, a fellow comic reader in the family. Say, if the book is any good, maybe that can be what Clyde and I start.”

“That’d be great,” Lucy replied drearily, though her family could detect the subtle hint of enthusiasm. “I know they say books are better than movies, but if you like the book, maybe you’d want to check out the show, too?”

Lincoln smiled, understanding what Lucy was really hoping for. “That’d be fine, but only if the book’s any good. Also, you have to give my future comic recommendations a try. Agreed?”

“Agreed.”

Lola scoffed. “Comics. Such unsophisticated garbage.”

“Unsophisticated?” Lincoln parroted incensed.

“Now you’ve done it.” Lisa’s voice was her usual emotionless deadpan, but like Lucy, her family could detect the subtle inflections that showed her annoyance.

Lincoln delved into a long and well-practiced tirade about graphic novels. The history, the evolved artistry of the panels, and the commonly accepted examples of stories that were better in comics than any other medium. Meanwhile, Lola smirked to herself as she drowned her pancakes in syrup, satisfied in her success at riling him up. Causing drama wasn’t quite as fun as gossiping about it, but it was pretty close.

After breakfast, and paying Lori’s fee for the ride, Clyde was picked up in Vanzilla and they set off to the comic store.

“Hey Clyde. Lucy said Vampires of Meloncholia, her show, is getting a comic spinoff. I was thinking we could check it out for our new series.” Lincoln explained this while sitting in the middle seat to discourage Lucy from trying anything funny with Clyde. Of all his sisters, she was among the least likely to pull something like that, but it never hurt to be careful.

“I don’t know,” the nervous boy said, rubbing the back of his neck. “Horror isn’t really my thing.” Then he caught Lori’s visage in the rearview mirror and struck a bold pose. “B-but I’m willing to give it a try, because real men face their fears.”

“VoM is more spooky than scary,” Lori added from the driver’s seat. After she and Leni agreed to start watching the show with Lucy, the blonde Louds had found a lot more to like than just the cute new actor. “It’s a character drama with a gothic setting. Lots of creepy atmosphere, but they don’t bother with cheap jump scares.”

Clyde sighed his relief. “Phew. I mean… phewww bad about that. I was really looking to test myself.”

“The real fear comes from the tension,” Lori continued. “Like that episode two nights ago. Edwin spent the entire time stalking that one girl, giving glimpses of himself now and then just to put the fear in her as she tried going about her day. By the end, she was a nervous wreck, and was practically begging to be taken just to be put out of her misery.”

“A rehash of an episode from season 1, but still very effective,” appraised Lucy. “Though now I’m actually afraid Leni might give me tinnitus from her screaming.”

“That’s what that was?” Lincoln asked. “I thought a jet had flown too close to the house.”

“I know, right,” Lori agreed. “I tried to calm her down with the usual stuff. Petting her, groping her, and fingering her, but she just kept going. With lungs like that, she ought to try for swim team.”

“What Leni needs is a full tummy. She’s always calm when someone’s inside her.” Lucy slowly and deliberately turned to face Lincoln.

“Gee, I’d love to ‘volunteer’,” he said with air quotes, “but I’m starting the comic to see if I like the show. I’ll need to watch a few episodes to be sure, which I can’t exactly do from inside someone.”

“… Dang it,” Lucy grumbled.

“What about you, Clyde?” Lori inquired with a scheming smirk. “It’d really help the viewing experience if Leni didn’t blow our eardrums out. Think you’d be willing to do me a favor?” She batted her eyelashes flirtatiously.

Clyde, having never fully gotten over his crush, turned to jelly in the seat. “Anything for you, Lori.”

“You’ll like being eaten by Leni, anyways,” Lincoln encouraged. “It’s relaxing how she rubs you while you’re in her belly. For a first time experience, I’d definitely recommend her.”

“What about me?”

“Sorry, Lucy. You’re belly’s fine, but it’s a little cramped for someone my size. However, if we finally get Clyde to see how great vore is, then we can work our way to you eventually,” Lincoln rationalized. As pushy as his sisters could be about it, he truly believed that being eaten was one of the best things someone could experience and he’d always hoped his best friend would see the light on that.

Lucy hummed thoughtfully. “Acceptable. Mind if I borrow your hand for just a second? I’d like to taste your fingers.” She reached out, but Clyde pulled away. For all his talk about wanting to give himself to Lori, the boy was still very much a virgin in every sense of the word. Just the thought of someone running their tongue over his body made him have to cross his legs. Luckily, Lincoln made sure to cover for him.

“Eventually, Lucy,” Lincoln emphasized. “I said eventually. Give the guy time. We don’t want to ruin the experience, do we?”

“I guess not. Sigh.” The goth slumped in her seat and took Lincoln’s fingers as a consolation prize, which he happily allowed.

“Don’t worry, man. Clincoln McLoud can withstand anything, even hungry sisters.”

Clyde’s laugh was nervous. “Thanks man. I can always count on you to have my back.”

Lincoln was grateful for Clyde as his first real friend outside the family. So many people tried brownnosing up to him in the hopes of getting off the menu for his sisters and mom; as if they just went around eating people at random. Honestly, the whole notion really offended Lincoln. Sure, the women of his life were pretty handsy and liberal with their tongues. However, they almost never brought someone inside them without some kind of provocation, either an invitation or if someone just pissed them off. His family was made up of predators, not monsters. His and Clyde’s friendship was born out of shared interests and just plain getting along, which meant he was safe to only be vored if he was willing. As for the other sycophants around town, Lincoln couldn’t care less.
1311211321211111111111.title: Will Clyde be Eaten?

13112113212111111111111.content:
After Lori parked, the younger kids disembarked from Vanzilla while she stayed behind to text. Inside, Lincoln and Clyde were having a ball welcoming a newcomer into their world. Lucy naturally gravitated towards the more monstrous and creepy covers, which the comic duo were more than happy to explain to her. This was a hero that turned into a monster, that was a monster trying to make it as a hero, and this was a regular person who turned into a monster that could be good or evil depending on the circumstances, but was still widely feared.

“Why didn’t you tell me about this earlier?” demanded Lucy. “All of these monsters with tormented souls. They’re just seeking people who understand them.” She stroked her hand longingly over a cover depicting some kind of mud monster about to sink its teeth into a screaming woman while an angry mob was shooting it. “I know your pain, dark and murky kindred spirit.”

“Hey, it’s not my fault,” asserted Lincoln. “I’ve been trying to get you guys on comics for years. And it’s not just the western stuff, either. There’s manga about super models for Lola, detective stories for Lisa, more sports’ books than I can even count for Lynn, that one’s about an up and coming rock band, and everything else. Oh, and all the vore themed porn books.” Lincoln finished by pointing to an entire isle that radiated with an almost heavenly glow and angelic choir.

“Once I was blind, but now I see. We must share this treasure with the rest of the family,” Lucy avowed.

“A nice idea, but how are we gonna afford it?” Clyde asked. “I don’t get that much allowance.”

“Don’t worry, guys. This one is on me.” Lucy pulled out her personal credit card. The card was custom decorated with art from VoM, along with ‘Predator’ in big bold letters to dissuade any would-be thieves. It had access to her private bank account where all the money she’d earned from voring volunteers had accumulated, minus the percentage that had been taken out and set aside for college. Maintaining a house full of preds was expensive, but luckily said preds did pretty decently in paying for their own upkeep with plenty to spare. “Pick whatever looks good. We’re going to show our family the darkness.”

Clyde raised his hand. “Uh, I think you meant light.”

“I know what I said.”

So the boys got a basket and loaded it up with what they felt were the best samples of what each of the sisters would appreciate, along with three copies of the VoM book. When it came time to pay, the teen guy behind the counter swallowed audibly upon seeing the card and became visibly shaken.

“W-well, if you b-b-buy ten or more books, you g-get our 10% bulk discount. W-will there be anything else?”

Lincoln rolled his eyes. “Dude, just relax. She’s not gonna bite.”

“Can I borrow your fingers?” Lucy licked her lips in anticipation. “I like the taste of fear.”

With a sigh that put Lucy’s to shame, Lincoln reached up, grabbed the guy’s arm, and pulled it down for Lucy to reach. As she took two fingers into her mouth and started licking, the boy explained, “See. She’s not gonna eat you. She just wants a taste. It’s like shaking hands for predators.”

“A-are you sure?” asked the nervous teen.

“As her brother, yes. I’m very sure.” Lincoln was rather adept at this conversation, having to explain his sisters’ behavior to the ignorant masses far more often than should be necessary. “If she wanted to actually eat you, she’d go for somewhere more intimate, like the neck or face.”

Lucy finally released the guy’s fingers and smacked her lips appraisingly. “Teen angst. Not bad, but I’ve had better. Now what was that about a discount?”

“I-I-I’ll even throw in the employee discount!”

“That will be nice. Thank you.”

The purchase was rung up and upon leaving, the guys were made to carry the haul while Lucy started reading.

“You did that on purpose, didn’t you,” Lincoln accused.

“I don’t know what you’re talking about. There was nothing about what just happened that was out of the ordinary.”

“I really wish I could disagree, but this isn’t my first shopping trip with the Louds,” Clyde said in defeat.

“You were totally scaring that guy on purpose,” Lincoln argued. “That was totally uncool.”

“If he wants to be afraid of me just because I’m a predator, that’s his prerogative.”

“Well he shouldn’t be. You’re not the monster he thinks you are and you shouldn’t be perpetuating the stereotype.” Lincoln pinched the bridge of his nose as they came up to Vanzilla. “Lori, please tell Lucy that she can’t go around scaring people.”

Lori turned an incredulous eye on her brother. “It’s Lucy. Scaring people is pretty much her thing.”

“Creeping up on people is one thing. I agree that there’s no stopping her there. But she’s making people afraid of her for being a predator. Doesn’t that bug you?”

Lori just kept scrolling through her phone. “Not especially. Stupid people are gonna be stupid no matter what. It’s no skin off my bones if strangers can’t be bothered to educate themselves. And if any of them try doing anything extra stupid, it will literally be the last thing they ever do. Why do you even care? This is a pred issue.”

Lincoln frowned. “I care because it’s a Loud issue. You’re my sisters and I don’t like you guys being stereotyped.”

“It’s really no biggie,” Lori dismissed.

“Besides, Lori likes freaking people out just as much as I do. You don’t complain then,” observed Lucy.

Lincoln pursed his lips, trying to think of a delicate way to get his message across. “That’s cuz Lori does things more… approachably. I realize that smiling and hugging people you don’t know isn’t exactly your thing, but there must be some Lucy way of interacting with people that doesn’t perpetuate harmful stereotypes.”

“Or, next time someone crosses you, you just eat them and say they were a volunteer,” Lori added nonchalantly.

“Lori!”

“Oh come on. I was only joking… mostly.” Lori finally turned a more focused look on her passengers. “That seems like a lot more comics than usual. How’d you guys-?”

“Comics aren’t as boring as we thought,” Lucy said. Still with her nose buried in her book, she pulled out a volume and handed it to the elder blonde. “I bought samples for everyone. This is a romance about the eldest princess trying to juggle three suitors. Also she’s a pred.”

Lori slipped her phone in her pocket and began flipping through the pages. “Hmm. Well she’s certainly pretty enough to warrant this kind of-” She snorted a laugh at the unexpected pratfall. “Okay, that wasn’t bad.” She flipped the page and her eyes began to sparkle as she fanned herself. “Oh, well isn’t he a tall glass of water.”

While Lincoln wasn’t ready to let go of his gripe with Lucy, he could take solace that at least Lori was enjoying her present. Once they made it back, the rest of the books were handed out and everyone seemed to like their new stories. Lincoln however, didn’t join them. The man with the plan had a scheme cooking.

Does he try helping Lucy with this perceived issue, or is something else going on?
13112113212111111111111.title: At the Comic Store

131121132121111111111111.content:
Up in the converted closet that was his room, Lincoln was pacing back and forth while Clyde was reading on the bed. “Clyde, I’m worried about Lucy.”

“I think we all are, though she’s got great taste in vampires. I really relate to Edwin.”

“I mean about her social life, such as it is. She’s got friends in her club, but she’s still such a…”

“Introvert,” Clyde suggested. “So am I. There’s nothing wrong with being comfortable all by yourself. That’s probably not so easy for you in this house, but the quiet is still pleasant.”

“And I get that, but it still seems like a predator should be a little, ya know, proactive in their hunting. All of my older sisters are so outgoing. They’re flirty, they get up close and personal, but then they start laying on the affection. Lana and Lola have this pretty down pat, too. Even if people are nervous at first, they’re put at ease and see what great people preds are. I like seeing when everyone’s happy and getting along. But with Lucy…” He trailed off, his meaning not needing to be said.

“I know this is kind of a sensitive issue with you, but are you really qualified to handle something like this?”

“What d’ya mean?”

“Well, you live in a house full of preds, most of them older and more experienced. If Lucy were, say, underdeveloped, don’t you think one of them would have stepped in by now? Mrs. Loud strikes me as the sort who’d nip a problem like that in the bud; or butt, knowing you guys.”

Lincoln frowned as he contemplated Clyde’s words. “You might be right, buddy. This isn’t my area of expertise, but I really want to be a good big brother.”

“Alright. So what did you have in mind?” Clyde asked while putting the book down. “I didn’t really have plans for today, so I’m up for whatever.”

Lincoln hummed thoughtfully and scratched his chin. “Hmm. If I’m not the expert, then I should find someone who is.”

Later, in Luna and Luan’s room…

“So, what do you guys think?”

“I don’t know, little bro,” Luna responded while strumming her axe. “At Lucy’s age, I was still pretty locked up in my shell, too. I ate who came to me, but didn’t really have the urge to go out and hunt.”

“Yeah, then you got a job at the pound, cuz you love hunting for pussy so much,” Luan joked, only to rethink her punchline as her hand stroked her engorged stomach, which had shrunk since this morning. “Hmm. I could do better, but I agree with you,” she said to the boys. “Lucy really ought to be a more active predator. Be a bit flirtier and lick people gently enough so that they don’t get grossed out. Well, as grossed out.”

“That’s exactly what I wanted to hear. So, can you help?”

“Sorry, Lincoln. I’ve got a kid’s birthday party in an hour and I need to borrow Lynn’s treadmill to work off this beer belly.”

“If yer lookin’ fer advice, I recommend Leni,” suggested Luna. “If there’s anyone who knows how to make prey relax, it’s her.”

Later still, in Lori and Leni’s room…

“Of course I’ll help.” Leni was her usual bubbly self, not to mention naked as the day she was born. Clyde was wide eyed, speechless, and bleeding from the nose. “I’ve always wanted to give Lucy a makeover, but she’s a wily one.”

“Makeover? No, we’re talking about making her a more proactive predator.”

“Oh. I guess I misunderstood, but that also sounds pretty fun. But we’ll need a good sales pitch.”

“What’s that mean?”

“It’s a retail thing, but it works equally well with predators. When out hunting and you spy someone who looks really yummy, you can’t just say you want to eat them and shove them in. That’s rude, not to mention they might start fighting, and that’s no fun for anyone. You’ve gotta sweet talk them, figure out what they want, and help them realize what they really want is the same as what you want: for them to go in your belly.” Leni patted her trim stomach. “Basically, Lucy thinks she’s fine, so we have to convince her that being a more active predator is for her own good.”

“Okay. That makes sense. Also, Clyde?” Lincoln snapped his fingers in his friend’s face, but got no response. “Uh, Leni. You mind putting some clothes on? You’re distracting Clyde.”

“Hey, you like reading in your undies cuz it feels comfortable, and I like being naked. Besides, we’re inside, so it’s allowed.” Crossing her arms under her ample chest, she blew her brother a raspberry to show just how mature the second eldest sister was.

Lincoln rolled his eyes and, rather than attempt bickering with a brick wall, decided to take Leni’s advice.
“So, something that would appeal to Lucy, aye?”

Even more later, in Lynn and Lucy’s room…

“You know, lots of people say that those who seek thrills for a hobby have a death wish, which is kinda true,” Lincoln began, causing Lucy to look up from her poem book. “It’s exciting falling through the air at high speeds, almost like death itself is on their heels. Same with things like the Running of the Bulls. It wouldn’t be nearly as popular if there weren’t that danger, that possibility of meeting a gruesome demise.”

“Please stop,” groaned Lucy, crossing her legs. “What’s your point?”

“My point is that, for most people, they get that same kind of thrill being with or even just near predators. You could make them feel like death is breathing down their necks, except it isn’t death’s breath.” He lowered his voice to a stage whisper. “It’s Lucy’s.”

“I’m in.”

“Agh!” Lincoln jumped and spun around to face where Lucy now stood. “You? But you were…” He pointed frantically between the goth’s bed and her current position, covering over 3 meters in the blink of an eye. “But I was staring at you the whole time. How-did-you-do-that?”

“Enough of your petty mortal concerns. Like comics, I must now teach the prey of the world the joys of being close to death, or at least her dark disciple.”

“Her?”

“Didn’t you know? Death is a woman. All the popular goth literature says so.”

“Fair enough. Leni’s agreed to show you the ropes. Now we just have to-hey. Where’s Clyde?” Lincoln looked around the room, but saw neither hide nor hair of his buddy.

“The shadows tell me he’s hiding under Lynn’s bed,” stated Lucy, making Lincoln flinch. “Yeah. That’s a mistake no one makes twice.”

Lincoln and Lucy armored up with clothes pins on their noses and thick gloves on their hands. Together they probed the uninhabitable wasteland that was the space beneath Lynn’s bed. The girl kept all her lucky clothes under there, the ones she never cleaned for fear of washing out the luck. Just lifting the sheets up released a tidal wave of stank that made both Louds gag. They found Clyde and quickly extricated him out into the open. After pumping on his chest and performing CPR, the boy finally took his first real breath after what felt like hours of suffocating.

“I… I saw the light,” Clyde said in awe as he reached up to the sky. “Death was escorting me to the pearly gates. She was so beautiful.”

“Told you,” Lucy boasted dryly. “Also, my newfound dream to share the joys of a brush with death was just beaten out by Lynn’s old gym clothes… I feel inadequate.”

Begin the lesson, or skip to a new plot?
131121132121111111111111.title: Helping Lucy

1311211321211111111111111.content:
Still naked, Leni now sat on Lucy’s bed and looked the goth girl over. Clyde lay beside her, still recovering his breath as she patted his head. “Hmm. Let’s start by seeing your technique so we know what we’re working with. Lincoln, pretend you’re just some guy. Act like you don’t know Lucy, and that you’re kinda put off by preds. And Lucy, I want you to make Lincoln accept you. You don’t have to eat him, but he does have to be fine with you licking somewhere other than his fingers. Now,” she clapped her hands, “begin.”

Lincoln pulled out his phone to scroll through videos. It didn’t matter what he found, so long as he put up a front of indifference. He’d even put on a black wig to further the illusion. Especially from Leni, this all seemed like pretty good practice so far, at least in theory.

Lucy swallowed anxiously and made her approach. “Hey there, you. Can I lick your fingers?”

“Eh?”

“I asked if I could lick your fingers.”

“Bleh! That’s gross. Why would I let you do that?” Lincoln questioned, keeping his eye on his phone.

“Because I’m a predator, and I’m curious how you taste.”

Lincoln took a large side step away from his sister, but otherwise said nothing.

“He’s running, but he hasn’t left,” Leni whispered. “Give chase. He wants you to chase him.”

Lucy tried just that and closed the distance. “So, um, do you want to know what it’s like to come close to death?”

“And with that, I’m out. A regular guy like me gets put off easily with talk of death.” Still watching his phone, Lincoln started to leave, but very slowly.

“Don’t let him,” Leni urged.

“No, wait!” Lucy grabbed Lincoln’s wrist. “I-I just…”

“Ugh, you again? Look, I’m very busy and I don’t have time for this,” Lincoln said, giving only a token effort to pull himself free.

“Wh-what do I do?” Lucy questioned anxiously.

“Something drastic. You’re losing him, so be bold! Make him want you.”

“Bold. Right. Um…” Lucy’s mind was racing, trying to think of something, anything to keep this boy here. What could she possibly do to make him want her? Hang on…

Lincoln rolled his eyes. “Are we done here? Cuz I’ve got way better things to do than-mmh!?” Lincoln’s words were smothered by a pair of cool lips pressed against his, and hard.

“Woo-hoo!” Leni cheered. “There’s some boldness to stop folks in their tracks.”

Lincoln was the first to break off the kiss. “Actually…” He trailed off, rubbing the back of his neck apprehensively.

“Constructive criticism is crucial for improvement, Lincoln. I can take it.”

Lincoln nodded. “For one thing, it didn’t feel all that passionate. It’s like how you’d kiss me normally. Not really show stopper material. You didn’t even use any tongue.”

“Use… tongue,” Lucy wrote into her notes. “This is good. Anything else?”

“Just kissing isn’t enough,” answered Leni. “Vore is, like, a full body kiss, so you need to put your full body into it. What are your hands doing? What are his hands doing? Where are the hips? Vore is a contact sport, so make that contact! Try again.”

“Okay.” Lucy looked back at Lincoln to see he’d switched back to his slightly annoyed persona. Taking a breath to steady herself, she lunged forward and pressed her body to his like she’d seen her sisters do with people. She slid her front up and down his sides, nuzzled under his chin, and teased around the groin of his pants. Additionally, the hand holding Lincoln’s wrist pulled it around and clamped it on her butt. Lincoln’s cheeks became flushed, which she took as a good sign.

Leni nodded. “Much better. However, that probably won’t work so well on prey Lincoln’s age. They haven’t hit puberty yet, so they’d probably be more scared if you touch their swimsuit area. Instead, make it more like a hug. Like you’ve been fighting with Lynn and have a makeup hug. And don’t forget to speak. That’s the real trick. Hold them so they can’t get away, and then convince them to stay.”

Lucy nodded and adjusted her position to be more like a hug and rubbed her cheek against Lincoln’s. The contact was nice, which she decided to share. “You smell really good and I like how warm you are.”

“Uh, th-thank you?” Lincoln was confused about what his character would do at this time, but reasoned he should probably take his hand off her butt now.

“I like being close to you. Normally I prefer the dark and cold, but you make me crave something more,” Lucy whispered into his ear. “I’m craving you… stranger. A-are you craving me?” That sounded like something her older sisters would say.

Lincoln had the same thought, which brought a grin to his face. “I kinda am, actually.” He returned the hug. “I wouldn’t mind getting a little closer.”

“I can get you close. Closer than you’ve ever been with anyone,” Lucy said rather desperately. “I can make you feel good, too. It’ll be exciting, like going down a water slide.”

“The best water slide of your life,” Lincoln whispered.

“The best water slide of your life. It’ll be warm, and wet, and I’ll hold you tight inside me.”

Leni applauded. “Perfect. That was just perfect! Good job, Lucy. I knew you had it in you.”

Maintaining the hug, Lucy turned to face Leni. “That felt super awkward. I was just doing what I thought you guys would do, but it didn’t really feel like… me.”

Leni waved dismissively. “That’s okay. It’s normal to start by copying others. That’s how art works. You just have to keep practicing until you get your own style. Well, I think that means you pass the first level. Now we do the, uh… level that comes next.”

“Second,” Lincoln and Lucy said together.

“Oh right. Silly me. Hey, Clyde.” Leni tapped his cheek. “Clyde, you up? We could use your help.”

Groaning groggily, Clyde slowly stirred to consciousness and beheld the tremendous sight of Leni’s big, round, and boobilicious chest pillows. “Error. Error. System overload,” Clyde said in a high pitched and stilted voice, twitching like a malfunctioning robot.

“This is why I asked you to put some clothes on,” Lincoln reminded.

“Oh fine,” Leni huffed. She left to go put something on, but came back in a set of lacey see-through lingerie. “Better?”

Lucy pursed her lips. “Sexier, but I agree with Lincoln. If we’re going to use Clyde for anything, he should be able to function like a regular human, or at least as regular as any of Lincoln’s friends.”

“Heyyy!”

With a roll of her eyes, Leni left and returned in a bathrobe. “How’s this?”

Lincoln and Lucy both gave a thumbs up.

“Okay, good.” Again Leni tapped Clyde’s cheek until he woke up. This time her bodacious boobs were at least covered, so he didn’t malfunction again. “Welcome back. So, Lucy just practiced hunting with Lincoln and did pretty well. But he’s her brother, so that makes him pretty easy to win over. So now we’re moving on to level… uh?”

“Two!” Lincoln and Lucy said as one.

“That one. Anyway, are you up for it?”

“Up for what, exactly?” Clyde’s voice was skeptical as his eyes kept drifting down into Leni’s robe. It was like he could hear her melons calling to him.

Leni smiled knowingly. “Do you like my boobies?”

“Yeees,” Clyde droned, only to recollect himself. “I-I mean, uh, what boobies?”

Leni appeared worried. “These boobies. The ones on my chest. See!” She cupped her hands under both breasts and pushed them up, almost popping them right out of her robes. “You see them, right? Tell me you see them. They didn’t shrink, did they?” she asked in increasing panic.

“He can see your boobs, Leni. You’re just overwhelming him,” assured Lincoln with a hint of annoyance. The second eldest sister was pretty smart when it came to being a predator, but was still dense about almost everything else.

Leni gave a relieved sigh. “Thank goodness. Anyway, I want you to let Lucy hunt you. She’s not going to eat you. She just has to make you comfortable with her being around.”

“And, uh, what exactly do I do?”

“Just do whatever feels natural. If she’s coming on too strong, tell her. If you want to back away, then do that. You’re the, uh, more difficult level. Think of it like playing hard to get. If you do a good job…” Leni pulled down at the collar of her robe. It wasn’t enough to show any pink, but the implication was clear as her eyebrows wiggled suggestively. “Lori told me you wanted to help us watch VoM.”

Clyde swallowed audibly and turned a shade of crimson.

Leni leaned forward and rubbed her cheek to his, (un)intentionally shaking her bootylicious posterior at her siblings. “That was really sweet of you to help like that. You’re a really great friend, and I’d be honored to be your first predator.”
