Lynn turned to Lincoln with an even wider grin. “Oh yeah. That one’s definitely worth chasing.” Then she turned to Clyde and looked him over. “So, now that Leni’s taken your vore cherry, does that mean you’re available for the Lynn Miester?” she asked while rubbing her stomach, earning a nose bleed from Clyde.

Though she still found the Louds super weird, seeing Lynn tease Clyde like that put Ronnie at ease, bizarre as that might have been. It helped to normalize the athletic Loud. That certainly would have been the sort of thing Ronnie would do if she were a predator and, ya know, into that stuff.

Where do things go from here?

Lynn joins the game.
Lynn leaves them to keep playing.
They go inside.
They go to Ronnie Anne’s place.
131121132121111111111111111111111.title: Hello Ronnie Anne

1311211321211111111111111111111111.content:
Clyde got a call on his cell and everyone waited for him to finish. “Sorry guys. My dads booked tickets to Les Mis and I almost forgot. Looks like we’re going to have to pick things up later.”

“Hey, no problem.” Lincoln shared a fist bump with Clyde before he ran home. “See you at school, buddy.” He waved goodbye and turned to his sister and other friend, looking thoughtful. “Lynn, since I’m down a partner…”

“I can play!?” she gushed excitedly.

“Only if you promise not to eat Ronnie,” he said authoritatively.

Lynn puttered her lips in defeat. “Fine, but we both know my way’s way more fun.”

Ronnie smiled at Lincoln coming to her defense. He might have been a dork, but he was also a pretty cool guy… not that she’d ever say so to his face. Everyone took their new positions to resume the chase. Lincoln yammered some in-game explanation for why he had to change partners, but Ronnie barely paid any attention. Lynn had agreed to leave her bike behind, but she was known as the athletic Loud for a reason. Even on foot, she posed an imminent threat. Ronnie could no longer afford to slow down to taunt her pursuers. Now the tables had turned and it was Lynn doing the taunting, always getting just close enough to grab Ronnie, only to break off at the last minute.

Ronnie’s heart raced each time the athlete drew near. Lynn’ smile also proved infectious, much to her prey’s annoyance. Despite herself, Ronnie was actually having fun being chased. She was still determined not to get caught and risk Lynn breaking Lincoln’s rule, but that just added a layer of excitement. Speaking of… “Whaaa!”

*CRASH*

“Ohhh…” Ronnie and Lincoln groaned as they lay tangled in a heap. Ronnie had been so focused on Lynn as she drove her skateboard up and down the road, she’d completely lost track of Lincoln. Between his sister’s athletic prowess and Ronnie’s wheels, the boy had fallen so far behind that he’d wound up ahead of them both, leading to the collision.

Lynn came to a halt over the pair, set her hands on her hips, and looked on with an appraising eye. “Whoa, that looks like it hurts. Hehe. Not a bad crash, Stinken. You make an excellent speed bump,” she praised.

“Ugh. Am I bleeding?”

Lynn rolled her eyes and checked her brother over with her hands. “Nah, you’re fine. Too bad. A few scars could’ve toughened you up.” She turned to inspect Ronnie, feeling her up far more than was probably necessary. “Same to you, though I’ve got to say you’ve got a nice body.”

Ronnie blushed. “I… what?”

“Yeah. You were rocking that board before. I can tell you must practice often. It really shows with the muscle balance. There’s room for improvement, but when is there not, am I right?” Lynn laughed. “How come you don’t try out for sports? I’m on, like, all of them for my age, but I get the feeling you’d be top of the league for your age.”

Ronnie smiled bashfully. “That’s nice of you to say, but I’m really not much of a team player, ya know.” She picked up her board and gave it a spin. “I’m more of a solo act, if you get my drift.”

“I hear ya loud and clear, sister.” Lynn laughed, which turned into a groan. “I’ve been hanging out with Luan too much. But there are still plenty of solo things you can try out for. I’ve been trying to get this knuckle head,” she pulled Lincoln into a headlock, “to join a racing team since second grade. His endurance might not be the best, but he knows how to call on some mad energy for short bursts of speed.”

“No kidding,” Ronnie replied, a little suspicious. “Where was that a few minutes ago? I was skating circles around you guys.”

Lincoln pursed his lips and averted his gaze. “I… didn’t want to leave Clyde behind. Then the game just kept going, and I guess I got tired.”

“Aww,” Lynn cooed as she gave Lincoln an affectionate noogy. “My little bro’s got team spirit after all.” Then she turned to Ronnie with a lascivious grin. “To be clear, when I say his endurance needs work, I’m talking about when his legs are moving. On his knees or on his back, and he can go for a stupid long time.”

“Lynnnn!” Lincoln whined as he tried to pull free. “You’re embarrassing me.”

Lynn stared blankly at him for a couple seconds before her coy grin returned. “And?” She laughed when he slumped in her grasp. “Aww, don’t take it so hard, bro.” She set him back on his feet and let him go. “That’s my job, remember? Bow-chica-wow-wow!”

Ronnie had never considered herself a very imaginative sort, but right now her mind was tormenting her with all manner of horrific scenarios. All of them involved Lincoln being naked with his family. Said thoughts were making her feel all tingly.

Then Lynn had a lightbulb moment. “Say, since we were both the hunters chasing our prey-”

“Not prey,” Lincoln interjected.

“-and you caught her, that means she’s yours to do with whatever you want,” she finished with a suggestive eyebrow wiggle.

Lincoln rolled his eyes. “Lynn, we’re playing spies, remember. When we catch the bad guy, we thwart her evil scheme which, in this case, was to take over the world.”

“Y-yeah,” Ronnie added nervously. “The day is saved. Yippee,” she cheered weakly.

Lynn shook her head. “No can do, bro. You know how these movies work. The best villains always come back in the sequels. If you want to save the world, you’re gonna have to lock this bad guy up somewhere she’ll never escape.”

“Lynn, stop it. I said you couldn’t eat her, so stop trying.”

“I know, but you saying I can’t just makes me want her more.” She looked past Lincoln and exaggeratedly licked her lips at Ronnie. “C’mon, girl. I can tell you’re curious. We can take it super slow and I’ll go any position you want.”

“No! Bad Lynn!” Lincoln pulled out a squirt bottle and sprayed Lynn in the face until she backed down. He positioned himself defensively between the girls. “Convincing is one thing, but you can’t go around pressuring people like that.”

“What? Yes I can,” Lynn asserted, holding her hands up like a shield. “I do it all the time.”

“Yeah, but with your friends, not mine. Now back off.” Lincoln sprayed her in the face again, making his sister hiss like a cat before grabbing her bike and scurrying off. Lincoln gave a relieved sigh and turned back to his friend, puzzled as to why her cheeks were so red. “Uh, you okay?”

“Y-yeah. I mean…” Ronnie rubbed the back of her neck. “No one’s ever defended me like that before. And I don’t think anyone’s ever fended off a Loud like that.”

Smirking, Lincoln tried spinning the spray bottle like he was a cowboy doing tricks with his pistol, only to fumble and send it flying. “Dang it.”

“I’ll get it,” Ronnie offered, running into the grass.

“Thanks, but it’s really not a big deal. My sisters can be pretty persistent when they want to eat someone, especially me, but you just have to know how to talk to them. With Lynn, if the spray bottle didn’t work, I had this.” Lincoln reached into his pocket and pulled out a red ball.

“Whoa, that’s impressive. And also hilarious,” Ronnie chuckled as she returned the bottle. “Is your sister part dog or something?”

“It’s a possibility that we’ve discussed many times in family meetings,” Lincoln admitted. “Actually, how about we trade. The ball for the bottle. That way if Lynn ever gives you trouble again, you can defend yourself.”

“What, really? But…”

“No worries. I have a bunch more stored in my room. The bottle’s more valuable, anyway. I just have to say its soapy water and Lana can’t run away fast enough.”

Ronnie chuckled as they made the exchange. “Whoa, dude. I know you like to call yourself the man with the plan, but I thought it was just some cheesy nickname. I didn’t realize you’d actually earned that title.” She regarded the ball and slipped it into her hoody’s pocket.

What does she say next?

Let’s go to your place.
Let’s go to my place.
Smell ya later.
What’s that over there?
1311211321211111111111111111111111.title: Lincoln to Ronnie Anne's Defense

13112113212111111111111111111111111.content:
Ronnie swallowed audibly. “So, uh, get any good video games recently?”

“Not for a few weeks, but Lucy got me on the first volume of a new comic. So far it’s got a promising start. Ya wanna read it with me?” Lincoln offered without a second thought.

“Yes,” Ronnie squeaked, but with countless second thoughts.

“Cool. I left my copy up in my room.” Lincoln motioned Ronnie to follow him, taking several steps before finally realizing what he was doing, but not the full scope of things. “You’re cool with coming inside, right?”

Just then, a paper plane flew out of the window. It caught the wind just right as it flew right into Ronnie’s hands. She unfolded it and read aloud. “That’s what she said. Then there’s a heart and its signed Luan.” She looked up at Lincoln before crumbling and tossing the paper. “Yeah, actually. I mean, so long as you’re there to keep your sisters in line, I guess I can-” She was cut short by a hand pressed against her mouth. Lincoln’s face was frighteningly close to her and he was shushing her urgently.

“Never say that when they’re in earshot!” Lincoln whispered. “They’ll take it as a challenge.”

“But… we’re not even on your property yet.” Ronnie motioned to the pavement.

“Just trust me, alright. My mom and sisters have their ways of knowing these things. Just… try to act normal. Don’t show fear, but don’t be too confident, either. There’s… a lot of ways to provoke my sisters, though usually they’re pretty behaved when company is over… relatively speaking.” He smiled awkwardly. “So, uh, about those comics.”

Ronnie Anne, despite every nerve in her body screaming to take the hint and just start running, replied. “Y-yeah. Let’s get to reading.”

Entering the Loud house was pretty much exactly what one might expect from the name. Lots of noise from shouts, laughter, whirring from the kitchen, the revving of a drivable toy car for kids, and what Ronnie was certain was an explosion. The girls of the house, the predators, were all doing their own thing and, much to Ronnie’s relief, barely paid her a second glance. Lincoln suddenly grabbed her by the hand and started pulling her up the stairs. She followed, mindful to heed his advice about keeping calm without looking overconfident. She also tried to not make it too obvious that she was huddling close to Lincoln for protection.

“So, what’s this book about, anyway?”

“Vampires of Melancholia, or VoM for short. It’s a soap opera about vampires. The characters are really glum all the time, but they face some interesting supernatural drama.”

“That sounds pretty neat. So what does it-oof! Hey, what gives?” She demanded irately. Lincoln had just stopped at the top of the stairs, resulting in her bumping into him.

Lincoln said nothing. He merely motioned for Ronnie to stay back as he ascended the final step onto the second floor. When nothing happened, he looked around, only to appear disappointed. “Typical. The one time I’m actually ready for Lucy, and she’s not even here.”

“Hey Lincoln.”

“Ahh!” Lincoln jumped back. “Luan!?”

“Aw, don’t be scared, little brother. You know my bite is worse than my bark. Or was it the reverse? I get the two mixed up sometimes.” Luan laughed and then clicked her teeth together in a chomp. All the while her hand stroked her distended, squirming belly. “Oh, hey Ronnie Anne. Haven’t seen you in a while. Did you get my message?”

“Oh yeah. That was funny,” Ronnie affirmed, mostly to keep the peace.

“Oh, c’mon. Don’t be such a stiff.” In the blink of an eye, Luan had closed the distance and pulled the younger girl into a bone constricting embrace. She also pressed her face into the younger girls neck, took a deep inhale, and gave a brief lick. “Mmh. You’re tasting awful yummy today. What’s the occasion?”

Lincoln cleared his throat and gently pulled Ronnie away from Luan. “We’re going to my room to read my new VoM comic.”

Luan’s eyes lit up. “The one with the vampires and the werewolves. Well, have you checked her yet?”

“Checked for what?”

“If she’s a werewolf, duh. You don’t want to find out after the full moon’s already risen. Haha. Get it?”

Ronnie frowned. “I… really don’t.”

“Linky likes to read comics in his undies,” Leni informed plainly as she strutted by and down the stairs, dressed only in a pair of shoes, sunglasses, and a purse. “You two have fun. I’m off to the mall.”

“Leniii!” Rita chided. “No nudity outside the house. Get that tight butt back upstairs and put some clothes on.”

“Oops. Sorry mom.” Leni hurried back up and down the hall to her room, though she was mindful to give her hips an added sway when she noticed who all was staring.

Ronnie had suffered a blue screen moment and was left gawking at the top of the stairs. So much had happened so quickly that she was having trouble processing it all. Luan… undies… Lincoln… dat ass! It was too much, too fast.

Lincoln, having seen this look before, took Ronnie’s hand and hurried her into his room where they were less likely to be bothered by his sisters. He closed the door behind them, just in time to miss the roaring of chainsaws from Lisa’s room.

Ronnie finally snapped out of her stupor. “Wha…? What happened? How’d I get here?”

“Sorry. Looks like you experienced an overdose of Loud,” diagnosed Lincoln. He pressed his forehead to hers to check her temperature. “Hmm. A little warm, but I don’t think it’s anything to worry about. So, uh, welcome to casa Lincoln.” He opened his arms to indicate his room.

It was all coming back to Ronnie as she looked around. This was the place Lincoln slept. She was now alone, with a boy, in his room, while a pack of rabid predators stalked the halls just outside. This had not been her smartest idea. “It’s, uh, kind of small,” she said, trying to distract herself.

Lincoln shrugged. “Yeah. It’s actually a converted closet, but I’m the only one in the house with his own room, so I take what I can get.” He looked around and wondered where he should start his little tour. “Uh oh.”

“What?” Ronnie asked, suddenly fretful that the sisters had broken in.

“Two copies.” Lincoln held up the two books. “Clyde must’ve forgotten his. Oh well. I can return it to him tomorrow. But hey, at least this means we each get our own book,” he said while handing a copy to Ronnie, which she tentatively took.

“Yeah, great. Um, I might have just imagined it, but it sounded like your sister Luan said something about you reading comics in your,” she swallowed, “undies.”

“Yeah, I do,” Lincoln answered plainly. “I like being comfy while I read and clothes are just so constricting.” Then Lincoln thought about his words and how they might be taken by an outsider. “I don’t have to if it bothers you, though. I’ve already read this one, so I can just wait for you.”

“N-no, no. that’s fine. I mean, this is your house. It wouldn’t be right for me to impose,” Ronnie said politely. On the inside, however, she was screaming at herself. Where were these words coming from and why was her mouth so insistent on spitting them out? “Besides, I’d feel awkward if you were just watching me read.” Which was honest enough.

“Okay, cool. I try to be mindful of the fact that not everyone’s used to this kind of environment,” Lincoln explained as he pulled his shirt off.

This revealed to Ronnie that he wasn’t quite as scrawny as she’d believed. There was some actual muscle definition there, if only a little. He continued stripping, turning around and letting his jeans drop. Ronnie’s eyes were starting to hurt from going so long without blinking. It almost felt like her peepers might pop right out of her skull when he turned around in his near naked glory, looking perfectly content with himself.

This was either the best idea Ronnie Anne ever had, or the worst…

What flavor of awkward will you choose next?

The pair read comics ‘peacefully’.
Nosy sisters are nosy.
Rita has some words.
Clyde calls Lincoln.
13112113212111111111111111111111111.title: Into the Lionesses' Den

131121132121111111111111111111111111.content:
Ronnie and Lincoln were just a couple of friends sharing a perfectly ordinary and friendly activity of reading together. Granted, one of them was in his underwear as he read his comic and the other was fighting to keep her eyes on her own book, but it was just so hard. The act of reading, not the… never mind. Lincoln was reclining on his bed, looking oh so relaxed as he flipped through the pages, while Ronnie had opted for his desk chair, which she had the misfortune of turning around to face the boy in his tighty-whiteys.

There was nothing unusual about this onset fascination. The only guy she’d seen in so few clothes outside a pool was her brother, and he was pretty bashful most of the time. Lincoln, by contrast, didn’t seem to have any shame at all. He’d just convinced himself that being in his undies was normal and no one could convince him otherwise, not that Ronnie had the ability or desire to. That tingly feeling in her belly was back and she had the oddest compulsion to feed it.

Then she took a few sniffs of the air. “Say, do you smell that?”

Lincoln also sniffed. “Smell what?”

“Ugh, you better not have farted.”

“What? I did not.”

“Then what smells like Bobby’s room whenever Lori comes over?”

“That… would probably be sex,” proposed Lincoln, the simple yet self-evident truth of his words hitting Ronnie like a sack of potatoes to the face.

“Oh… So you…”

“Laundry was yesterday. And given that I’ve showered recently, that means you’re most likely smelling Leni, Clyde, me, and the twins,” he listed off on his fingers. “Not all at once, though.”

“You and… Clyde?”

“No. Clyde and Leni. She sucked him off before eating him, then she asked me to f-to stick it in her butt, and after that the twins decided to…” Lincoln trailed off. “It’s a predator thing. There’s no way to not make it sound weird.”

“You sure? Cuz I’d be willing to listen,” Ronnie offered, putting the comic down. “What happened with the twins?”

At her insistence, Lincoln delved into the story of how he’d helped the twins practice unbirth, followed by their insistence on thanking him with a dual blowjob. That prompted Ronnie’s curiosity of what it was like being with a girl as big as Leni. This, in turn, was followed up by Lincoln giving the cliff notes on the other things he’d done with his sisters that would have been washed off by the shower. By the end… “Uh, Ronnie Anne. Your nose is bleeding.”

“Huh?” She wiped her nose and confirmed the presence of red. “Whoa. How’d that happen?”

“Here. I’ve got a tissue.” Still in his underwear, Lincoln casually closed the distance between the pair and handed her the white material. “You okay?”

Ronnie wiped her nose clean, all while struggling against her wandering-eye syndrome. “Yeah. I’m just… wow. You went through all of that in one day? How are you even still alive?”

Lincoln shrugged. “Mom and Lisa say I’m an inert predator, which I guess means I get things like a stamina boost, but I can’t actually swallow anyone.”

“Even so, it’s crazy that you do stuff like this every day.”

“Admittedly, today my sisters are a bit more demanding than usual, but it’s nothing I haven’t dealt with before. After a certain age, predators are as horny as they are hungry.”

“Yeah, but don’t you think it’s, like, unfair that they take all that out on you?”

“Not really. Do you think it’s unfair when your mom makes you do the dishes or take out the trash?”

“That’s totally different.”

“Not how I see it. Having all these urges makes it tough being a predator. And honestly, while it can get annoying sometimes, I’m happy doing what I can to help my family get through the day.”

Ronnie’s nose crinkled like she’d detected another offensive odor, namely bullshit. “Uh huh. And the daily sex with a bunch of pretty girls is… what? A bonus?”

Lincoln held up one hand and set the other over his heart. “That’s my story and I’m sticking to it.” In the awkward silence that followed, it was Lincoln’s turn to notice that something was off. “Say, did it suddenly get a lot quieter out there?”

His words were followed up by a commotion just outside his door, like a bunch of people were suddenly tripping all over themselves. Sharing a suspicious look, Lincoln and Ronnie decided to investigate. The moment the doorknob turned, the usual level of clamor had returned to the Loud house. Everyone was out doing their regular things like bike riding, poem reading, scaring Leni with a spider, and even Lori seemed to be talking unnecessarily loudly into her phone. To Ronnie, the hall looked roughly like it did when she’d arrived. However, while Lincoln couldn’t quite put his finger on it, something seemed off. Still, so long as everyone was keeping to themselves, it wasn’t his problem, so he closed the door.

The moment the door latched shut, everyone stopped whatever they’d been doing and Lori gave the signal to Lisa. The genius activated her sound machine, compiling recordings of the daily affairs of the house and recombining them into a new sequence. The point was to throw off suspicions of those who knew what to listen for – namely other Louds – and cover for the illicit activities of the other members of the house. In this case, since listening at the door had proven too risky, the sisters had all gathered in Lisa’s room to the transmitter that Luan had placed on Ronnie earlier. They were just listening. It wasn’t like Lisa had a secret network of cameras hidden throughout the house to monitor her family’s every move… anymore.

“So, where were we?” asked Lincoln.

“We were talking about how you have sex with your pred family all the time, and how you treat it like a chore that you’re also proud of.”

“Chore’s not exactly the word I’d use. Is there a softer word for obligation? It’s not like I have to do this stuff, though I kinda do, but it’s something I feel like I ought to do. Like that one time I came over and you got dinner prepped for your mom after a long shift at the hospital. That was just a nice thing you wanted to do to help out a loved one. Well it’s the same for me.”

“But with sex…?”

Lincoln shrugged. “Sure. Is it really that weird?”

“For anyone else, that wouldn’t even be a question. But for someone living in a house of preds, I honestly have no idea.”

“Uh, my eyes are up here,” Lincoln pointed out with mild irritation.

Ronnie’s blush returned with a vengeance at being caught staring. “I-I knew that.”

Over in Lisa’s room, the sisters were all snickering quietly into their hands.

“I-I knew that,” Lynn mocked in imitation of Ronnie’s voice.

“She literally wants him so bad,” agreed Lori.

“Plus he’s in his underwear,” reminded Luan. “Is anyone else craving pickles and eggs? Cuz I bet Ronnie Anne is. Haha. Get it?”

Lisa was scribbling in her notes. “Fascinating. He’s utterly oblivious and she’s in denial. Most curious. Could it be that a lifetime with us has left Lincoln oblivious to the less obvious signals of human attraction?”

“What’s that supposed to mean?” asked Luna.

“That you people have the subtlety of…” Lisa paused. “I can’t even think of a hyperbole that doesn’t pale in comparison to us Louds on a daily basis.”

Lori gave a dismissive wave. “So Lincoln’s a little slow when it comes to girls that aren’t us. No big. We just have to apply a little matchmaking magic and they’ll be good as gold.”

“Magic? But Lucy isn’t back yet,” Leni pointed out.

“Also I’ve got a date with Sam tonight, which I really ought to be prepping for, dudes,” Luna reminded. “Can we take a rain check on this?”

Lori rolled her eyes. “Okay, fine. For now, we’ll just observe. Proper meddling in Lincoln’s love life will begin once we’re all in top shape. Agreed?”

“Agreed,” the other sisters sounded as one.
131121132121111111111111111111111111.title: We're Just Friends, Right?

1311211321211111111111111111111111111.content:
In Lincoln’s room, Ronnie had made peace with the fact that things weren’t going to make sense all at once for her. Preds had their own way of doing things, which extended to Lincoln. So she decided to give reading the comic another try. Time passed and it grew easier to keep her wandering eyes in check. She was getting used to Lincoln in his undies, imagining them as just an unusual type of swimsuit. That, unfortunately, got her thinking about swimsuits in general. All the older Loud ladies were super sexy. No doubt they were the center of attention whenever they visited a pool. Ronnie wondered if Leni in particular might forget to put her swimsuit on. Against such an onslaught of sexiness, should one of the ladies decide that they were hungry, who could resist their request?

Ronnie shook her head clean of such thoughts. She was acclimating to nearly naked Lincoln, but now her head was being plagued with images of the rest of his family. It wasn’t like she’d suddenly become bi… At least she didn’t think so. The Louds were just so… much. Thinking back to when Luan had licked her, it was actually kind of nice. Luan was being so friendly and it felt weirdly good to be complimented like that. The Louds were a very friendly kind of predator and it made sense how they got so many willing meals. Bobby’s obsession with Lori was starting to make more sense to the young girl. It wasn’t just that she was smoking hot and matched all his fetishes. The Louds just had this naturally inviting atmosphere around them. But if that was the case, to what extent did it apply to Lincoln?

Lincoln looked up from his book just in time to catch Ronnie staring, which left him perplexed as she pressed her face into the book. She’d said that she didn’t mind him being in his underwear. Had she lied just to be polite? If so, would it be rude to call attention to it? Ronnie just looked so uncomfortable and he hated it. That’s when he remembered his go-to strategy for dealing with problems like these. He sat up, startling Ronnie, and slipped his clothes back on. “Don’t mind me. Just gotta use the restroom.”

“Oh, o-okay. Well, have fun.” Ronnie’s smile was awkward and her internal scream was deafening.

Lincoln just nodded and stepped out into the hurricane of Loudness, but something was still off. It was like everyone was a little too into their activities. Leni had gotten dressed, but she still hadn’t left for the mall. Lincoln decided that it was none of his business and instead made for the nearest sister who could meet his needs. “Hey Lori. Got a sec?”

Lori said a brief goodbye to whoever she’d been talking to on her cell before turning her full attention onto her brother… something that almost never happened. “What is it, twerp?” she asked as is she didn’t have her suspicions.

“Can we talk in your room?” he asked quietly. “It’s kinda private.”

“Did someone say privates?” Luan popped up, which caused her belly to bounce and squirm. “Cuz there’s plenty of those in this house. Haha. Get-hmmf?”

Lori had slapped her hand over her sister’s mouth. “Whatever you say, Lincoln. Follow me.” She gave a quiet look of warning to Luan before removing her hand and escorting her brother to the room at the far end of the hall. With her back to the boy, the eldest sister tried not to look too smug as she emitted an aura of triumph to her other sisters. The door was closed and she planted her grand booty on her bed before motioning Lincoln before her. “First, you have to pay the toll.” She slipped her shoe and sock off before presenting her foot to Lincoln.

“Oh come on. Really?”

“Really. If you want advice, you’ll have to pay.” Lori flexed her toes for emphasis.

Lincoln rolled his eyes and quietly scolded himself for not seeing this coming. Of course he couldn’t get something for nothing. The dominant currency of the Loud house was favors, but at least this was relatively mild. Lincoln knelt onto one knee and grabbed Lori’s foot, mindful of her ticklish spots. He pressed her toes under his nose and inhaled deeply like he knew she liked. She bit her lip when he slipped her big toe into his lips. It tasted like skin and smelled like sweaty socks; neither of which had much appeal for the boy. He pulled more toes into his mouth and weaved his tongue between them. Lori’s groans told him that he was doing a good job. For all the years he’d done this, he ought to be some kind of expert by now. When he saw Lori’s hand start to slip into her pants, he decided to end things now. Any further and things would only get more awkward for Ronnie.

“So about that advice,” he began, ignoring his sister’s glower. “Ronnie Anne’s being kind of awkward right now. I think she’s bothered by me reading in my undies, but she’s just too polite to say anything.”

Lori snorted a laugh. “Ronnie Anne’s a lot of things, but I don’t think she’s the overpolite and sensitive type. You sure you’re reading the signals right?”

“I’m absolutely certain I’m not, which is why I’m asking for advice.”

Lori smiled proudly and began examining her nails to feign disinterest. “Well, you’ve obviously got good taste and have literally come to the right sister for help.” Her eyebrows rose when she saw movement under the door and swore internally at her inability to stop the eavesdroppers. Granted, not that she’d do any different if the roles were reversed, but it was the principle of the thing. “If my mastery of tween magazines is anything to go by, which it absolutely is, I’d say that Ronnie Anne’s at that age where prey girls are just starting to notice boys. Being alone in a boy’s room while he’s practically naked is pretty wild for someone like her. At her age, I’d be all over the guy. In fact, I pretty much was.” She sighed fondly at the memories of her young crushes.

“We’d start with a little cuddling. I’d get a feel for them, and then the tasting would start.” Lori licked her lips. “I’d ask if they wanted to play dress up, strip them bare, and then…” She trailed off after spotting Lincoln and remembering what this was all about. Composing herself, she said, “That’s probably what Ronnie Anne wishes she could do. But even as brazen as she can be with most things, this is a pretty taboo subject that leaves prey, especially the girls, super confused.”

Lincoln frowned. “But Ronnie Anne and I are just friends. She doesn’t want to do that sort of stuff with me.”

Lori’s eyes rolled with enough force to throw the earth off its axis. “You’re nice to her, you share interests, you defended her from Lynn, and she’s seen you nearly naked. If nothing else, she’s definitely thinking about it,” she stated flatly. “The only question now is which of you will work up the nerve to make the first move.”

Lincoln blinked like a deer caught in the headlights. “Is… is that really what’s happening right now?”

Lori smiled. “It’s okay if you’re not sure. You’re both prey, so no one’s expecting you to just mount her like she was a Loud. If she’s having issues with you in your undies, try doing something that she wouldn’t find as awkward. You both like video games, right?”

Lincoln nodded. “Yeah, but that would mean going in the living room,” he pointed out, the implicit dangers not needing to be elaborated on.

“Don’t worry. I’ll have a talk with the rest of the sisters. We’ll go easy on Ronnie Anne since it’s her first day here, but don’t expect this to be an indefinite thing. Preds are naturally affectionate. Clyde got used to it, So she’ll have to as well.”

Beaming brightly, Lincoln propelled himself onto Lori’s lap and wrapped his arms around her waist. She was too big for his fingers to touch, but the sentiment was clear. “Thanks, Lori. I knew I could count on you.”

Lori made a sound like a purr as she rubbed her grateful brother’s back. Preds had greater tactile sensitivity compared to regular people, meaning that they absolutely adored hugs. Whether inside or outside the belly didn’t matter. They just liked being close to people. And as his sister, Lori couldn’t get enough of Lincoln initiating affection with her. Her imagination began to run with the possibilities. The Loud ladies were naturally meddlesome when it came to one another’s love lives. Lincoln was not exempt. It was an unspoken understanding that, unless explicitly told otherwise, everyone’s boyfriends and girlfriends were free game for the preds. It was also a universal desire among the elder sisters that when Lincoln did find a girl he liked, that he and she would inevitably be spending some shared belly time together. Lori’s belly had been rocked plenty of times by Lincoln going at it with the other sisters, but a girlfriend was a whole new level of intimacy that made her loins burn just thinking about it.

But never mind all that. What happens next?

Lunch time already?
Lincoln and Ronnie Anne play games.
They try reading comics more.
Lori can’t stand waiting any longer.
1311211321211111111111111111111111111.title: Lori's Advice

13112113212111111111111111111111111111.content:
A simultaneous growl from Lincoln and Lori’s bellies was followed up by a ringing of the doorbell. It was lunch time at the Loud house.

Lincoln hopped from his sister’s lap and gave her a salute. “Thanks again, Lori. I’ll give you a few minutes to spread the word.”

“Good boy, Lincoln,” Lori said louder than was probably necessary. “You go get Ronnie Anne and I’ll have a talk with the sisters.”

Suspicious, Lincoln returned to the hall and made a brisk walk to his room. “Sorry for taking so long. Anyway, it’s lunch time. We’ve got some microwave pizzas if you want.”

Ronnie gave a relieved exhale and set a pencil in the book. With Lincoln gone, she’d actually made some progress in the story. It was good, and it wasn’t half bad at taking her mind off the complexity of her situation. Then she processed what all Lincoln had just said. “Uh, did you say lunch?”

“I did, but don’t worry. Lori’s talking with the others so they’ll back off a bit.”

It was like Ronnie had become 50lbs. lighter.

“But,” Lincoln amended, “it’s not indefinite. Preds are naturally affectionate and basically nothing can stop them from grabbing and licking whoever they want, but you have my word that it won’t go further than that. No one’s going to eat you without your permission. I promise.”

Ronnie wasn’t sure if she’d become light enough to float away, or if she was wearing cement clothes. Lori would always give her and her mom looks whenever she came to visit Bobby. Now she was about to get the same treatment from all the Louds? Taking a page from Lincoln’s book, she decided to count her blessings and accept this reprieve. “Thanks a lot, man. It means a lot that you’d stick your neck out for me like this.”

“Hey. What are friends for?” Lincoln opened the door, bowed with a dramatic flourish, and gestured outside. “Mi’lady.”

Ronnie snickered. “Started cool, then you go right back to being a dork. You’re crazy, man.” Her laughter was cut short when she saw an Asian man in his late twenties step out of Luan’s room. He looked disheveled and was soaking wet, but appeared in high spirits. Luan escorted him out, now sporting a more trim stomach. The pair exchanged some friendly words before Luan slapped him on the butt to encourage him to pick up the pace. Awkward smiles and half-hearted attempts at greetings were shared between the man and the other Loud sisters. Ronnie could only gawk in silence as the truth of the scene settled in her brain. That man had just been eaten, pooped out, and now he was going back to whatever counted as a normal day for him while the Louds did the same.

Lincoln shook her shoulder. “You okay?”

“I-Yeah. Erhem. I’m just, uh, really hungry.”

“So is everyone else.” Lincoln watched his sisters descend the stairs. “Want to give them a couple minutes to sort out the volunteers?”

“Volunt-uh…” Ronnie cleared her throat. “I mean, I’m good. Bobby isn’t that great about closing the door whenever Lori comes over, so I’ve seen enough.” That was the truth. It wasn’t like she peeked through the keyhole to watch her brother go at it with the sexy blonde. That’d be weird, and definitely not something she could confess to, especially in this house.

With a shrug, Lincoln led the way down the stairs. Ronnie followed close behind and noted how several sisters had gathered in the living room. Rita, the voluptuous goddess of a woman, opened the door and welcomed in a group of strangers of varying ages, races, and sexes. All looked somewhere between nervous and excited as they lined up in front of the TV at Rita’s direction. With hardly any hesitation, they all began to strip while the Louds ate them up with their eyes. Ronnie could barely pull her eyes away and almost slipped on a step. It was only thanks to Lincoln’s mindfulness that she was saved from being injured, or worse, embarrassed. The girl decided that it was best to keep her eyes on Lincoln as they turned left and away from the predators and prey. That said, Ronnie’s eyes did linger on a girl a little older than herself with a similar complexion. She was grinning bashfully when Lynn approached and planted a full on kiss to her mouth.

Past the dining room and in the kitchen was a short line of other Louds before the fridge. Mostly the youngsters and Luna. The door was opened and everyone quickly picked out what they wanted before scattering to do their own thing. Lunches were generally not a family affair for the Louds, unless you wanted to count what was going on in the living room.

“Hey there, dudette,” Luna greeted warmly as she bit into a sandwich instead of just swallowing it whole. “How’s the Loud house treatin’ ya?”

“Still trying to get my bearings,” Ronnie admitted. “You guys are certainly a nice bunch, though.”

“Aww. That’s sweet of you to say.” Luna reached out to ruffle Ronnie’s hair.

Ronnie checked that Lincoln had put his selections of pizza and some leftovers in the microwave. With time to kill, she decided to converse with the freckled beauty. “So, uh, how come you’re not eating anyone?” If it were possible, Ronnie would have psychically slapped her head off. What was up with her mouth today?

“Nah. I had a tall glass of water yesterday, so I’m good. Besides, I’ve got a date tonight.” Luna pinched her exposed midriff. “Want to make sure I’ve got room for my girl. It’s just common courtesy to have a clean belly before taking in someone new.”

“Oh. So, do you eat her often?” Both Lincoln and Luna snickered at her question. “What?”

“Dude, Sam can barely keep her hands off me; or out of me, in this case,” Luna laughed. “It’s a good thing preds are so strong. I wouldn’t be able to show her around if she spent the whole time inside me like she wants.”

Ronnie’s curiosity was peaked, along with her desire to drown out the noises from the living room. “Sorry if this sounds ignorant, but you don’t want her in your belly? I thought that’s something all preds loved.”

Luna smiled appreciatively. “Thanks for askin’, but I like Sam for more than jus’ belly time. I want to show her around, take her to nice places, maybe go dancing, and then rip her clothes off and shove her inside me.”

“Shove?” Lincoln questioned with an amused grin. “Last time I saw you two together, it looked like you were trying to hold her back.”

Luna blushed and rubbed the back of her neck. “Yeah. Thanks again for the assist, bro. I owe ya.”

“You owe me, like, six. Not that anyone’s counting.” The microwave dinged and Lincoln took out the pizza and leftover chicken bites. He then turned to Ronnie with a bemused expression. “The dining room has a clear view of the living room, so that’s probably out. Let’s see here. I’d usually go to my room if I don’t want to get involved.”

Ronnie’s mind raced with every possible implication of what ‘involved’ meant.

“Oh, I got it. We could eat on the back porch so you don’t have to see anything.”

“That’d be great.”

After directing Ronnie to grab them some juice boxes, Lincoln carried their plates out back and planted himself down on the steps.

Ronnie sat beside him and they ate almost entirely free of the lewd groans and sexual exclamations from inside. She tried to take a bite of her pizza, only to burn her mouth. “Ow-ow-ow! Too hot!” She fanned her tongue.

Lincoln quickly poked a hole in the box, jammed the straw in, took aim into his friend’s mouth, and squirted with all his might. Ronnie sighed after swallowing the refreshingly cool liquid.

“Quick thinking, man.”

“Between a lifetime of video games and my family, I’ve probably got the sharpest reflexes around,” he boasted.

Normally, Ronnie would treat such a proclamation as a challenge, an invitation to bring Lincoln down a peg. However, given how many times he’d pulled her butt out of the fire in just the last few hours, she figured she’d let him have this one. The pair ate in relative peace, chatting about the comic, school, and other miscellaneous topics. A cool breeze rustled the leaves and added to Ronnie’s sense of peace. Being like this with Lincoln was nice. She didn’t have any other way of putting it. He was a nice guy with a nice – if odd – family. He was cute, less of a wimp than she’d thought, and had the ability to hold his ground against the most intimidating people she’d ever met. And to top it off, while he was eating with one hand, his other hand looked strikingly unoccupied while dangerously close to hers.

What happens next?

Suppress her feelings and keep on eating.
Grow a pair and grab his hand.
Her phone rings calling her home.
Cut back to what’s going on with the predators.
13112113212111111111111111111111111111.title: Lunch With Guests

131121132121111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ronnie felt like she’d been spending countless seconds eyeing up the boy’s greasy chicken covered fingers. She’d held it before. Or rather he’d held hers. It’s not like there were any rules against her setting her hand down and interlocking her fingers with his. Lincoln, she reasoned, had been conditioned to accept affection from others, especially girls. The worst case scenario would be that he’d pull away from her, which made her heart sink just to think about. Except he wouldn’t do that. That wasn’t the kind of guy Lincoln was. If even half the things he’d said were true, then his sisters were on him pretty much all the time, so why would he pull away from a simple hand holding? More importantly, why was Ronnie devoting so much brain power to something so lame?

She was Ronnie Anne Santiago for god’s sake. She liked riding her skateboard and giving swirlies to dorks like… people who were similar to Lincoln, but weren’t as cool. Gah! No. I do not think Lincoln is cool. The point was that she wasn’t the sort of girl who fretted over stupid things like stupid hand holding with stupid boys.

It was almost a relief when the back door flew open to free Ronnie of her internal dilemma. Lynn rode out on her dirt bike, once again dressed only in a helmet and jockstrap. Only this time she was sporting a gut that almost doubled her total mass. “Woo-hoo! Yeah, feel that burn, baby!” Her feet pumped the peddles faster than most people could track as she rode laps around the yard.

Having been startled by such an alarming sight, Ronnie hadn’t quite noticed that she’d pressed herself against Lincoln for safety, or that his arm was wrapped protectively around her. Alas, this detail was not lost on their elder who rode up to greet them.

“Hey, Ronnie Anne. Like what you see?” Lynn turned to the side so that her giant belly was no longer cramped against the steering. There were slight bulges and bounces any time the girl inside moved, along with barely audible sounds. “Yeah, just doing some post-meal exercises. Not only does it burn off the extra calories, but it makes sure the added material goes where it needs to,” she explained while flexing. “Momma needs herself a new pair of glutes.”

“Come on, Lynn. You know what mom said about being naked outside,” Lincoln griped while gesturing at Ronnie.

Lynn scoffed. “The backyard still counts as inside. The fence is basically a wall. Besides, it’s nothing either of you haven’t seen plenty of times.” She cupped her hands under her budding breasts and gave a more wicked grin. “Yeah, you like it, girl. Being a pred gives me a head start with stuff like this, but I can tell you’re totally jelly.”

“I-I am not!” Ronnie blurted, finding her voice. “And that-that’s cheating. All those people you eat makes you bigger and… bigger.” She pointed accusingly at the older girl’s chest. “Well enjoy it while you can. As soon as mine come in, they’re gonna be way bigger than yours.”

Lynn threw her head back and laughed uproariously. “As if, girly. I’ve not only got a head start, I’ve got pred genes and a super exercise routine on my side. I’ve eaten girls five years older who still didn’t have sweater puppies like these.” She rolled her nipples between her fingers in a taunting gesture. “By the time I’m Lori’s age, I’ll be as much a bombshell as her, only with better muscle definition.” She flexed her arm and kissed her bicep. “What’ve you got going for you?”

“Targeting shyshtem aligned. Ready to extract the idiot,” Lisa said as she aimed the net gun from the window. She was stopped by Lori who just saw Lincoln stand and position himself between the girls. Things might yet work out.

“Lay off her, Lynn. I’ll have you know that Ronnie Anne’s mom is super-hot. Maybe not Ms. Dimartino hot, but she’s still as much a bombshell as any prey woman I’ve seen. That’s what Ronnie Anne has going for her,” he argued while gesturing back at the stunned girl. “I think we all know that if you were both prey, she’d surpass you in no time.”

One time Rita had eaten an extra-large meal, even by her standards. She’d been so bloated that she didn’t look before sitting and accidently crushed Lynn under her tremendous phat ass. That impact was soft compared to the brute force of Lincoln’s words. “O-oh yeah? Well… let’s see who you like more after I digest you,” Lynn threatened.

Lincoln rolled his eyes and marched up to his sister until her belly was squished between them and their noses were practically touching. “Go right ahead.”

Lynn froze in powerless frustration at her bluff being called. She’d never actually digest him. And with her belly already full, she couldn’t even eat him in retaliation. Feeling like she’d been backed into a corner and needing to strike back, Lynn pulled her belly back before preparing the biggest and most aggressive belly slap she could muster to knock Lincoln over.

“Now!”

Lynn had no time to react before she’d been encased by a net and yanked into the sky like a caught fish.

“Sorry for the delay, Lincoln,” Lori called down as she helped Lisa with their squirming catch. “You did pretty well, though. Very manly.”

Once Lynn had been pulled out of sight, Lincoln turned to Ronnie, feeling more awkward than ever. He’d just called her mom a bombshell as a compliment to her! Did normal people do that? He was pretty sure they didn’t. Would she understand what he’d meant, or had he just crossed a line that could never be uncrossed?

Unable to look up from the plate with some pizza still left, Ronnie stood up. She took the plate with her over to Lincoln. She couldn’t meet his eyes, but she still felt that he was owed a reaction. “You think my mom’s hot, huh?”

Every eavesdropping Loud winced.

“I-I’m sorry. It was a, ya know, spur of the moment thing. I didn’t mean it. I mean, not that you’re mom isn’t pretty or anything. Urgh!” Since he didn’t have any sisters to do it for him, Lincoln pulled off his shoe and shoved the end in his mouth before he could say anything else stupid.

“So you think I’ll be as pretty as her someday?” Ronnie inquired, still not meeting his gaze.

Praying to whatever deities that might listen, Lincoln removed the shoe from his lips and hoped that the following words wouldn’t cost him a treasured friendship. “I think you’re already pretty.”

Ronnie’s breathing grew heavy as her blush turned a similar shade of magenta as her favorite hoodie. She scarfed down the remaining pizza and almost choked before finally working up the nerve to look Lincoln in the eye. She opened her mouth, but no sound came out. After roughly an hour of her mouth doing its own thing, it picked now of all times to abandon her. Typical. Oh well. With her voice out of commission, but the need to express herself lingering, Ronnie did the only thing that made any sense. She kissed Lincoln’s cheek, pushed him over, and then ran through the house and out the front door, picking her skateboard up along the way before bolting down the street.

Lincoln just laid there on the dirt and stared up at the partially cloudy sky. A girl had just kissed him. He’d been kissed by a girl who was neither family, nor someone’s food. That had just happened, hadn’t it? The phantom pressure of her soft lips against his cheek suggested that it had. A girl had just kissed him, and it had been Ronnie Anne of all people. Lincoln had no words.

The Loud ladies also lacked any words. They only had ear-piercing screams that threatened to break all the glass in the house, and possibly the neighborhood. Those who’d had the decency to not eavesdrop were quickly brought in on the dramatic turn of events, and subsequently join the celebratory screaming. Even Lynn, bound and gagged, felt compelled to join the cheering. A love of family drama was one of the few interests that the Louds shared and the notion of privacy was more theoretical than anything. Everyone loved to gossip and be a part of everyone else’s business and a kiss like that would definitely be a topic of discussion for quite some time.

What happens next?

Lincoln gets the third degree from his sisters.
Lincoln needs a break and visit’s Clyde’s house.
Skip to Sam and Luna’s date.
What’s up with Ronnie Anne, anyway?
131121132121111111111111111111111111111.title: Definitely (Not) Just Friends

1311211321211111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was some time before Lincoln found the strength to pull himself up and go back inside. The door had barely closed behind him before he heard it. The stampede of heavy footsteps descended upon him as several big-bellied and excited looking sisters surrounded him.

“O.M. Gosh! That was, like, totes adorbs,” Leni gushed, hands resting atop her squirming belly.

“So brave,” Lola swooned, trying not to get pushed around by the many distended stomachs. “Like a gallant knight swooping in to save his princess from the crass monster with no concept of tact or dress sense.” Her romantic tone flattened towards the end when she spied the still bound Lynn.

“Not cool, dudes. I thought we’d called a rain check,” Luna whined.

“Plans change,” Lori said dismissively. She squatted down to Lincoln’s level and maneuvered her giant, distended stomach to the side so that she could set a hand on his shoulder. “You did great, little bro. If Bobby ever did anything like that for me, I’d shove him up my pussy and wouldn’t let him out for a week.”

Lincoln’s eyes went wide. Off the top of his head, he couldn’t think of anything Lori might say that would come close to such high praise. “W-was I really that good?”

“My undershtanding of human shocialization ish shtill limited, and even I could tell that you were in the zone,” remarked Lisa.

“Oh, hey Lucy. You busy?” Leni asked into her phone. “I’ll be quick. You totes missed it, though. Ronnie Anne came over and, like, totally kissed Linky. Uh huh. Yeah. We all saw it. Well, have fun with your friends. We’ll tell you all about it when you get home.” She turned around to find all the sisters giving her the stink eye. “What?”

“You all saw it, huh?” questioned Lincoln.

Leni gasped in horror. “Oh no. How’d you find out? That was supposed to be a secret.” Her words were answered with the harmonious slapping of eight hands to eight faces, and one thud of Lynn’s head to the floor since she was still tied up.

Lincoln rolled his eyes. “I guess I shouldn’t be too surprised that you were all watching. Not like we didn’t all do the same when you started bringing Bobby and Sam over,” he conceded, resigned to the inevitability of the Loud house. Then he looked at Lynn. “Except you. What were you thinking talking about your boobs to Ronnie Anne like that? Were you trying to make her uncomfortable?”

Lynn had finally worked the gag off her mouth. “Hey, it’s not like I was trying to eat her or anything. I was just hitting on her, ya know. Maybe if she saw how awesome I looked, she’d be down for some f-mmh!” Her words were muffled by the gag being moved back into place.

Luan checked the bindings around Lynn’s wrists and ankles before hoisting her up. “This is quite the stuffed turkey we’ve got. All in favor of throwing it in the freezer until Thanksgiving, say aye.”

“Aye!”

“The vote is unanimous. I’ll just take care of this.” Luan hauled her struggling sister over to the fridge, made some room inside, and tossed her in before returning to the others. “Anyway, how was your first kiss? Did it make you want to join her in going… over the moon? Haha. Get it?”

“Luan, that wasn’t a real first kiss,” argued Lori. “That was just a peck on the cheek. Cute, but it doesn’t really count until after they’ve had lip-on-lip action.”

“We talking top lips or bottom lips?” Luan gestured at her skirt. “Cuz Lincoln’s pretty good with both.”

Lori rolled her eyes and turned back to face Lincoln. “Best not to bring up that sort of thing until at least the second date, which you can’t do until you’ve had a first date. You two share classes at school, right?”

Lincoln nodded.

“Try playing it cool for a couple days. Talk to her like you usually would so she doesn’t get too overwhelmed. I’ve had dates that literally freaked out the first time I brought them over. Usually I’d just stuff them in my belly until they calmed down, but you can’t do that, so you’ve got to try the more delicate approach. Give her some time to think things out, but make sure she knows that you’re still her friend. She’ll need that support.”

Lincoln raised his hand. “Sounds good and all, but how do you know what dating is like from a prey girl’s perspective? I’m not sure she even likes vore, yet.”

Lana scoffed. “Oh please. No one can set foot in this house without at least getting curious.”

“Plus I totes caught her checking me out earlier,” Leni giggled.

“The best preds know how to make our food want to come to us,” Lori bragged while feigning interest in her nails. “And given how much raw predator energy we give off just by being awesome, she’s definitely into it.”

“Okay. I guess I can’t argue that,” Lincoln conceded. “So tomorrow I just play it cool. Be her friend and don’t try to be pushy.”

“If it helps, ask yourself what Lynn would do, and then do the opposite,” suggested Lola to everyone’s amusement.

Then there came a thud from the kitchen. Everyone turned to find Lynn had pushed the door open and was now shivering on the floor. That’s when Rita came up. “M-m-mom. L-L-Luannn th-threw m-me in the f-f-f-freezerrr.”

“Because you were harassing Lincoln’s friend after being repeatedly asked not to,” Rita informed tersely. She scooped up her daughter, removed her bindings, and carried her to the living room. “I think some ass time should set you straight.”

“Aww mooom!” Lynn whined as her mother began unzipping her pants.

With that settled, everyone’s attention returned to Lincoln.

Lori appeared thoughtful. “Hmm. Now that you mention it, I think you’ve got a point. Ms. Santiago is quite the bombshell, especially for prey.” Her grin grew devious as she shared knowing looks with her fellow elder sisters. “Next time I’m visiting Bobby, maybe I should-”

“No!” Lincoln shouted. “You said I can’t do anything to scare her off, well the same applies to you guys. If you start being too aggressive with her family, that might scare her off as sure as anything Lynn would do.”

“Dang it,” Luna voiced everyone’s thoughts as she snapped her fingers in disappointment. Then she checked her watch. “Oh shoot! It’s almost time. I, uh, gotta go. Love ya, fam. K-thanks, bye,” she said as she hurried off to meet her date. Then she poked her head back into the room and added, “I’m calling no interference on my date.”

This was met by a round of disappointed snapping fingers and a near unanimous “Aw shucks.”

Luna beamed her satisfaction and left. With that out of the way and their sisterly advice imparted, the Loud sisters agreed that there was nothing more they could really do today and dispersed to resume their respective interests. Lori drove Leni to the mall, Luan went back to her room to plan her next birthday party gig, Lynn was indisposed, Lucy had yet to return, the twins went outside to play, Lisa resumed her experimentation, and Lily was put down for a nap. That just left Lincoln with nothing but time and his own thoughts. He opted to finally play a video game; something casual that would enable him to keep on thinking.

He’d been kissed by Ronnie Anne. Granted, it had just been on the cheek, so it didn’t count as a first kiss, but it was still a kiss. You only gave those out to people you liked. Ronnie Anne liked him, at least enough to kiss him, but how did he feel about her? She was fun and cute, a little rough at times, but he’d taken worse from his sisters. Hanging out today had been pretty fun, but it definitely would have been better if she’d been more relaxed. However, as Lori had said, that part was now on him. He had to help put her at ease. Lincoln had no delusions that his sisters were doing this as much for themselves as him, if not more so. Everyone wanted to eat Ronnie, just like they’d done with Bobby and Sam. That was just how they showed affection and welcomed someone into the family. All Loud dates had been put through the same ringer, and now it was Ronnie’s turn. As he lazily shot the zombies on the screen, Lincoln quietly vowed that he’d make sure that Ronnie passed and was welcomed with open arms and open mouths.

Where do we take things from here?

The next day
Luna and Sam’s date
A sister needs Lincoln
Rita needs Lincoln
1311211321211111111111111111111111111111.title: Meddlesome Sisters

1311211321211111111111111111111111111111.content:
The next day, Lincoln woke up bright and early. Once the bathroom routine was out of the way, he got dressed and performed his morning exercises. Today was like any other Tuesday morning for the Loud house. It was like all the chaos of the weekend, but on fast-forward. Everyone had their own routines that they needed to prepare for the day, or just get out of their system before having to sit at a desk for hours on end. Lynn especially embodied the latter as she threw balls at anyone with an open pair of hands, or tried wrestling anyone who got within arm’s reach. Lincoln ducked as soon as she tried jumping him, resulting in her falling down the stairs… again. It was cool. She’d taken worse damage.

“Hey Lincoln.”

Lincoln greeted the girl with the blue streak in her hair with a salute. “Hey, Sam. You have fun last night?”

“Is that even a question?” she asked facetiously while holding Luna’s hand and giggling. She wore her usual target shirt, aqua jacket, and torn purple pants. All these things she’d wisely stowed in an overnight bag for when the inevitable happened. “Luns really knows how to show a girl a good time.”

“Damn skippy I do,” Luna affirmed with a firm slap to Sam’s behind, making her squeak cutely.

“Well, I’m just glad you both hit the shower before rush hour. Everyone ate last night, but knowing my sisters, you’d probably still end up inside someone.”

“Aww. Are you concerned for me?”

Lincoln shrugged. “We’re kinda competing to be Luna’s favorite meal. As your senior in being eaten, I figured I ought to look out for you.”

Sam scooped the boy up in a giddy hug, burying his face in her chest. “Oh man, Luns. You’ve got the cutest brother ever. Say, think there’s time for a quick threesome?”

Lincoln’s response was muffled by the girl’s chest.

“I’m sorry, what was that?”

Lincoln inhaled. “I said there’s no such thing in this house. Now you guys better hurry up. Mom said that if we’re late again, then she’s bringing out the corks.”

Just the mention of the dreaded ‘c’ word made every Loud in earshot flinch. The cork was a device that, when shoved down a predator’s throat, hindered their ability to swallow anything bigger than a basketball. When vore was seen as more of a reward than a punishment, the corks were Rita’s ultimate leverage in keeping her daughters in line.

“How about we put in a pin in that threesome, aye luv?” requested Luna in her well-practiced British accent. “You can hold off until lunch, right?”

Sam made her most adorable pouty face and nuzzled under the taller girl’s chin. “I can, but I don’t want to,” she bemoaned while swirling her finger against Luna’s chest. “You sure we can’t-”

Luna grabbed Sam by the shoulders and spun her around to face her fully. “Luv, corks don’t come out for a minimum of three days, and they fit up my pussy, too.”

When the gravity of Luna’s words finally sunk in, Sam flipped the script by grabbing her girlfriend’s shoulders and practically dragged her down stairs. “Look alive, ladies! If anyone’s gonna be late to school, it ain’t gonna be us.”

Luna looked back over her shoulder and shared a snicker with Lincoln.

“Man, Sam needs to come by more often. She’s a great motivator,” Lincoln observed just before whipping out an umbrella and deflecting a bucket of ice water. “Sorry, Luan. I saw you setting that one up last night.”

“Oh, I know you did,” the jokester said, half still in her room. “The real question is what you didn’t see.” She laughed sinisterly and retreated back into the shadows.

1311211321211111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ms. Johnson’s class was the same as it ever was, and yet it felt so different. To Lincoln’s left was his best friend Clyde, but to his back was Ronnie, his maybe girlfriend. Class hadn’t quite started yet, so he took the chance to turn around and smile at her. Her reply smile was forced, uncomfortable, and she couldn’t hold eye contact for very long. Not good. Usually this was the part where he’d try strategizing with Clyde or a sister, but the subject of discussion was literally right behind him. If he said something she didn’t like, a hamburger bun down his undies would be among her more mild reactions. God forbid if she got creative.

Lincoln didn’t have long to dwell on the issue before Ms. Johnson came in and began the lesson. Luckily it was fractions, which Lincoln was already fluent in. Living with ten sisters, it was pretty common that whenever someone found anything of value, it would need to be divided evenly to keep the peace. But as confident as he was in the lesson, he couldn’t get Ronnie out of his head.

“Psst,” Clyde whispered. “She’s looking pretty down. You should say something.”

“I can’t with the lesson going on,” Lincoln argued, only to have a lightbulb moment. “Wait, I can’t say anything.” He grabbed some scratch paper and jotted down a message, only to erase it and start over. He had to pick his words very carefully so as to spare Ronnie’s feelings and his tender skin. Finally he’d gotten the message as close to perfect as possible. Checking to make sure the coast was clear, he crumbled the paper into a ball and tossed it over his shoulder… only for it to be caught before it could reach its goal.

“Ahem,” Ms. Johnson cleared her throat as she eyed the crumpled paper in her hand. How did she get there so quick? Was Lincoln surrounded by secret teleporters, or was his peripheral vision not what it should be? “Passing notes, are we?”

“Notes? Uh, no. That was just some scratch work I did. My hand writing was terrible, even for me, so I threw it away. But…” Lincoln checked to find that the window was open. “I aimed for the trash, but the wind blew it off course.”

Ms. Johnson’s expression went from a disapproving scowl to low-key impressed. “Not a bad excuse, Loud. You come up with that just now, or were you saving it?” That got some snickers from the rest of the class. “So, do we need to go through the song and dance of having you read the note to the whole class, or will you behave?”

Lincoln sunk down into his seat. “I’ll behave.”

Ms. Johnson nodded curtly and returned to the front of the class. “I should hope so. Your mom has all of her children’s teachers submit weekly reports on your behavior. I’d hate to tell her that you were being less than your best.”

Rita was the sort of nosy mom that, under any other circumstance, teachers would secretly hate. However, given that she’d birthed ten people with the ability to swallow humans whole, her need to intervene was most welcome. Most of the Loud siblings were behaved most of the time, but it was generally believed that the teachers could only keep such order thanks to the threat of calling Rita. Whenever Lynn started getting too hyper in a game, Luan disrupting lessons with pranks, or the ever present threat of eating anyone they didn’t like, just the mention of Rita was typically enough to calm things down. Only a pred could keep other preds in line, and Rita was more than happy to give that proxy power to the teachers. And Lincoln, despite not being a pred, was cowed just as easily as his sisters by such a threat.

This was a side of Lincoln that Ronnie hadn’t seen before. With his sisters, he’d held his ground, but just the mention of his mom was enough to make him surrender. It made sense, though. Her own mom could be quite the beast when she got angry. Ronnie could only imagine how much worse it’d be with a mom who was also a pred. In a way, Lincoln was living in fear of his family just like everyone else. Perhaps it was because he couldn’t see her, but Ronnie found the nerve to smile sympathetically at the boy. Crazy as it may have seemed, this felt like just one more reason to like him.

The lesson went on like normal with minimal interruptions and ended with a pop quiz. Then came lunch. Lincoln and Clyde carried their lunch boxes to their usual table, followed shortly by Ronnie who sat on Lincoln’s other side.

“So…”

“Yeah,” Lincoln replied. Recalling the advice of his sisters and Sam, he decided that now was as good a time as any. “I missed playing video games with you yesterday.”

“Huh?”

“I got a third controller. How about after school, you, me, and Clyde hang out at my place and blast some zombies? Sound fun?”

“It does, but I’m certain I failed that quiz, which definitely means I’m getting extra homework tonight,” Ronnie bemoaned.

“No problem. I can tutor you. I’m pretty sure I got fractions in the bag, so I can definitely give you some pointers.”

“Don’t forget me,” Clyde interjected. “I’m not exactly confident in my fractions either. Like which is bigger, a fourth or a fifth?”

“That’s fine. We could have a study session together. Just the three of us.”

“Any chance on making it four?” asked a tall Filipino girl.

“Hey Stella. I was wondering when you’d get here,” welcomed Lincoln.

She sat down and pulled out her lunch. “Sorry. My locker was being stubborn. Luckily I remembered that trick you showed me and it opened like a safe.”

“Trick?” Ronnie asked.

“Lori showed me this way to hit the even numbered lockers to make them unjam. Kinda sad that this school’s had the same problem for half a decade and no one’s bothered to fix them.”

“Even so, thanks for the advice,” Stella said. “So is that a yes to a fourth on your study date?”

The mention of the ‘D’ word got Ronnie’s attention. Outside of school, she’d never seen reason to hang out with Stella. She didn’t dislike the girl, per say, but neither had she made the time to get to know her as she’d done with Lincoln, and Clyde as an extension. The ‘D’ word, however, got her thinking. Stella was tall for her age and pretty cute. Lots of guys fawned over her when she first transferred, but she’d singled out Lincoln and Clyde to be her friends. Ronnie had thought that friendship was all that the new girl wanted, but now she wasn’t so sure.

To Ronnie, it looked like Lincoln wasn’t showing any signs of being smitten, so he probably thought of Stella as just a friend. He appeared to be trying to play it cool with the both of them, which was probably good. Lincoln hadn’t outright rejected her. Most likely he was just waiting for a chance to talk to her alone about what happened, which was probably what the note was meant for. Ronnie continued to ponder the issue until a solution presented itself.

They were going to Lincoln’s house to study. Perfect. That place was not for the faint of heart. Ronnie had a stressful enough time just hanging out and reading comics. Clyde was no doubt used to it, but Stella would be totally blindsided. Even if she knew what preds were like, actually meeting so many was a whole different matter. Ronnie imagined that the most likely scenario would be that Stella would still be Lincoln’s friend, but would be thoroughly frightened away from any romantic prospects. All she had to do was nothing, and the problem would resolve itself.

“I’m glad you’ll be joining us, Ronnie Anne,” Stella said. “I’m sorry that I’ve been a part of this friend group for a while, but never really got to know you. You always seemed super cool, so hopefully we can have fun hanging out.”

… Dammit!

Lori tittered, reached into the doll house, and scooped up her littlest sibling. “How’d you guess?” She didn’t give him time to answer before depositing him into her cleavage. It was the most convenient position for all involved, keeping the carrier’s hands free while affording Lincoln a decent view. Not to mention he felt really good wiggling against a pair of sensitive breasts.

Lori’s bosoms were soft and just a little bit squishy, making them ideal for reclining. Lincoln did just that, or at least as best he could while his lower half was wedged within boob flesh. He gave a contented sigh and spread his hands out, feeling the way his sister’s skin bristled with goose bumps. It was a nice feeling. “Oh, you know. Just a feeling,” he replied blissfully.

“Heeey!” whined Leni. Second oldest, her figure was almost as curvy as Lori’s, though she had more of a ditzy charm that tended to draw in more boys. “How come you get Lincoln today? I thought it was supposed to be my turn.”

“It was, before we made that bet, remember?” Lori reminded smugly. “You lost, which means that your day now belongs to me.”

Lincoln was broken from his relaxation by the sight of his sad sister. Leni in particular was such an innocent soul that it actually hurt to see her upset. “That’s not fair, Lori.”

“Oh, what do you care? My boobs are bigger than hers, anyway.”

Lincoln had to struggle to twist around and face the tyrannical sister. “It’s not about boobs. It’s about being a good brother. Today was Leni’s turn and you shouldn’t have made that bet in the first place. Besides, just because it’s your turn, that doesn’t mean you’ve got me exclusively. Clyde’s coming over today, remember.”

“I do, but I don’t see the problem,” Lori dismissed. “I’m sure he’d be just fine doing whatever it is you guys do while staring at my chest all day.”

Lincoln grimaced. “Okay, probably; but my point still stands. Besides, it’s not like you asked me about this dumb bet. I might be a minizora, but that doesn’t mean you get to treat me as an object to be passed around.”

Lori scoffed down at the boy in her cleavage. “Lincoln, that’s literally what being a minizora is all about. You can’t look after yourself, so it’s up to your family to keep you safe. And, as a part of this family, that means you’ve got to pull your weight around here, bucko.”

Lincoln rolled his eyes. “Yeah, I know, which is what I’m arguing for. Today is supposed to be Leni’s turn. She’s been waiting over a week for this; and honestly, so have I. How can you just take away our day together?”

“We were going to go shopping,” Leni sniffled.

“Seriously, Leni. You’re too nice for your own good sometimes. Time with Lincoln is like time in the bathroom. You want it; you’ve got to seize it when the other’s aren’t looking.”

Lincoln heaved a heavy sigh. Lori wasn’t wrong. He loved his sisters and liked spending time with them. The turns system was supposed to keep things fair. But alas, too often his sisters would get impatient. One minute he might be critiquing Lucy on her latest poem, and then she’d turn her back and he’d find himself in the audience of Luan’s latest joke routine. And then there were all the things that happened outside the turns. Even if it was Lola’s turn, Lyn would still get to borrow him by shoving him in her jockstrap and going through an elaborate exercise routine as part of her superstitious sports rituals. Then there were the deals. Sometimes it was a bet, but others it was like when Luna offered to do Lana’s chores for a week if she got to bring Lincoln along for her date with Sam. That… had been a nice night. Admittedly, the system was pretty broken, but it was still preferable to total anarchy.

Fortunately for Lincoln, it was actually Leni who delivered the winning argument. Not with eloquent words, as those had never been the blonde airhead’s strong suit, but with action. Specifically, she started whimpering like a kicked puppy. Lincoln had to shield his eyes, for no one with a soul could withstand Leni’s unparalleled pitifulness. Lori, however, wasn’t so quick.

“Ugh, fine,” groused the eldest. “I still won, so I’m keeping Lincoln until lunch. You can have him after that. Sound fair?”

Leni perked up immediately and rushed over, wrapping Lori in a constrictive embrace. “Thank-you-thank-you-thank-you! You’re the best!” As she gushed, she also unknowingly smothered her chest against Lincoln, compressing him between a boob and a soft place. Fortunately, he was used to this kind of treatment. The only surprising thing was that when Lori finally pushed Leni away, Lincoln was still wedged in Lori’s cleavage.

“Yeah, yeah. I know I’m great,” Lori replied, nonchalantly checking her nails as her free hand adjusted her bra. Though it was really an excuse to coax Lincoln into wiggling more. As every Loud sister knew, his little body was a boundless source of stimulation. “Okay, Stinken,” she said down to her boobs. “Ready to get this Saturday started?”

1314.title: Loud Shrink

131411.content:
“Hello everyone. Lincoln Loud here,” he said, beginning the morning by breaking the fourth wall. “You’re probably wondering why my room looks so different. Well, that’s because it is. It’s actually my sister Lori’s old doll house. See, I was born a minizora. That means that at a mere three inches tall, I don’t have much chance of getting any bigger, but that’s life. And really, my life is pretty great, all things considered.

“I’ve got loving parents, ten awesome sisters, and pets that actually don’t want to chew on me. Then there are my clothes, a private TV, game station, comics, and pretty much all the essentials of life at a miniature size. I even have a private bathroom, though it’s more like a tiny porta-potty that needs to be emptied once a week. Really, I’m pretty lucky. Granted, being so small, I’m pretty dependent on my sisters for a lot of stuff. I’m basically not allowed to go anywhere outside the house unless one of them is carrying me. Worse, because I’m so small and cute, most of the time they insist on carrying me inside their clothes. That can get pretty nasty when one of them has a gas attack. Bleh. But usually it’s fine.

“My mom and sisters have really soft, warm bodies, so except for a bad gas attack, I don’t mind being carried around in someone’s bra or even panties. And being a minizora, I’m durable enough that I can take pretty much whatever life throws at me, even my family using me as a communal sex toy. Again, not usually a problem. My family does so much for me and it’s nice that I can give something back. It’s like my household chore. Certainly beats taking out the trash, I can tell you that.”

There came a knock at the dollhouse door.

“And it looks like my day is about to get started.” Lincoln casually headed over to the red plastic door, ready to greet the world with a smile on his face, but who was there to greet him?

1331.title: Vore

13311.content:
It was a day like any other for Timmy Turner. His parents had left him in the hands of his sadistic babysitter to do god-knows-what. The boy’s only solace were his fairies, Cosmo and Wanda, who could grant him just about any wish he could think of. There were rules, of course. No killing, no messing with true love, no cheating in official competitions, yada-yada. However, in ruminating over Da Rulez, Timmy had a small epiphany.

“Hey Wanda. I’ve got a question,” he called.

A goldfish with pink eyes swam out from the little castle in the fish bowl. “What’s up, sport?”

“I was just thinking about Da Rulez. Specifically the part that says I can’t wish anyone in or out of love.”

“That’s true, sport. Even fairies can’t go messing with stuff that powerful.”

“Right, and I get that, but what about lust?”

“… Say what?”

“Lust. Like, I can’t wish someone would fall in love with me, but can I wish that they fell in lust with me? You know,” his eyes shifted guiltily, “just curious.”

Frowning, Wanda pulled out a copy of Da Rulez and began flipping through the pages. Her expression paled as she read the book backwards and forwards. In time she noticed Timmy giving her an expectant look and figured that there was no point delaying the inevitable. “Uh… no. There are no rules on anything related to sex.”

Timmy rubbed his hands together. “Sweet. In that case, for my first wish…”
